meanings.definition: A legal agreement by which a bank or other creditor lends money at interest in exchange for taking title of the debtor's property, with the condition that the conveyance of title becomes void upon the payment of the debt.
meanings.sent1: My parents took out a mortgage to buy our house.
meanings.sent2: The bank approved their mortgage application quickly.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my pet hamster could never afford a mortgage.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the mortgage on his shoulders felt heavier each day.
meanings.sent5: The word 'mortgage' always reminds me of our cozy home.

meanings.definition: To convey or pledge (a property) as security for a loan.
meanings.sent1: They decided to mortgage their land to expand their business.
meanings.sent2: She will mortgage her car to get the money for the trip.
meanings.sent3: I teased my friend that he might mortgage his bicycle for cash.
meanings.sent4: His decision to mortgage his future for short-term gain was risky.
meanings.sent5: The idea to mortgage the antique clock seemed like a desperate move.
